items.content_html:
Make cascading order table and described algorithm to be compliant with CSS Cascading and Inheritance Level 5 (Editor's Draft 11 January 2022).

Additionally, I believe that changing user-defined style sheet, in the example of the origin precedence, to the author style sheet would be more beneficial for the web developers as they need to know how it actually might affect their styles, rather than user-defined style sheet.
items.title: Change Cascading Order table

items.content_html:
Summary

Improved TDZ concept of "let".

  1. It said "let variables cannot be read/written until they have been fully initialized" which is wrong. "let" can be read/written even before initialization if it is declared in the code.
  2. "let" variable is in the TDZ from the start of the block until the declaration. After declaration, we can read/write it.

Motivation

MDN is my favorite website for references and guides. I noticed this mistake and want to help improve it so that other developers don't get confused and learn the right concepts from the right place :)

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Update index.md where TDZ is misleading

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR adds a link to the newly created page for reportValidity to the "Client-side form validation" guide found at the link below.

  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Forms/Form_validation#implementing_a_customized_error_message

Motivation

Previously, the link pointed to a table of HTMLInputElement methods because the page for the specific method didn't exist. Since the specific page now exists, the link can point directly to it and save people an extra click.

Supporting details

The new link:

  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLInputElement/reportValidity

Related issues

items.title: Link to reportValidity page

items.content_html:
This PR updates the Sensor API for new-style event pages.

  • Ran yarn content move Web/API/Sensor/onerror Web/API/Sensor/error_event

  • Ran yarn content move Web/API/Sensor/onreading Web/API/Sensor/reading_event

  • Ran yarn content move Web/API/Sensor/onactivate Web/API/Sensor/activate_event

  • Updated https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Sensor:

    • Moved the "Event handlers" section to an "Events" section
    • Linked to xxx_event pages instead of onxxx
    • Sort events alphabetically. Update descriptions

  • Updated Web/API/Sensor/activate_event (moved in the first step)

    • Updated to new-style event page. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/MDN/Structures/Page_types/API_event_subpage_template for the template.
    • Added example code.

  • Updated Web/API/Sensor/error_event (same update as activate event, but note this is of type SensorErrorEvent)

  • Updated Web/API/Sensor/reading_event (same update as activate event)

  • Searched all of mdn/content for "sensor.on" to update any pages that reference sensor "on" event handlers and updated them. Did some adjacent changes like adding inheritance diagrams and fixing syntax boxes.

BCD change is approved in mdn/browser-compat-data#13926
items.title: Update Sensor API for new-style event pages

  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting @dependabot rebase.

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
  • @dependabot merge will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

items.content_html:
I don’t know how to include the sample result, nor how to update the compatibility table. According to https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/semantics-other.html#selector-invalid the fieldset:invalid is part of the spec. https://caniuse.com/?search=%3Ainvalid doesn’t mention fieldset specifically, but does include form:invalid; IE is, of course, out, while curent Edge is in (older Edge was out).

Summary

Motivation

Supporting details

items.content_html:
Summary

This is a complete overhaul of the window.open() page and accomplishes the following:

  • Cuts down on the verbosity of the page.
  • Reorganizes the page to fit the API method subpage template.
  • Removes misleading or outdated information.
  • Clarifies the code examples

Things that should be considered:

  • There was an edit to this page in response to #11988 that I left out because I think the issue is better answered now with the rework, but to each their own!
  • This is my first contribution to MDN, so feedback is appreciated. This should be considered a first draft.

Hopefully I did this right!

Motivation

There is an open issue to overhaul this page. See below.

Supporting details

Related issues

Fixes #4583

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Window.open() complete overhaul
